DOC.brief_summary: - To evaluate infusion flow rate attainable use proximal humerus proximal tibia IO vascular access site . - To evaluate intraosseous infusion physiology use proximal humerus proximal tibia IO infusion site . - To evaluate relationship IO venous blood use laboratory test . - To determine time IO needle insertion IO access establish .
DOC.detailed_description: Often emergencies medical situation , doctor must gain vascular access ( access blood stream ) order give drug and/or fluid patient . The common way gain vascular access place needle vein skin , sometimes possible . Another way gain vascular access insert needle skin , bone give drug and/or fluid patient center bone , hollow contains blood vessel . This call intraosseous ( IO ) vascular access . One device use gain intraosseous vascular access call EZ-IOÂ® Intraosseous Vascular Access System use proximal humerus ( upper arm bone ) , proximal tibia ( upper shin bone ) , distal tibia ( low shin bone ) . The EZ-IO cleared FDA establish IO vascular access site identify infusion drug fluid anytime vascular access difficult obtain emergent , urgent , medically necessary case . IV fluids medicine must infuse patient 's blood stream different speed depend upon infuse . Some IV fluid medication must give slowly must give quickly . How fast IV fluid medicine infuse blood stream call infusion flow rate . One way increase infusion flow rate apply pressure ( squeeze ) IV fluid bag use . This do applying pressure bag around IV fluid bag , act like blood pressure cuff inflate pump . The purpose study see quickly IV fluid infuse blood stream proximal humerus ( upper arm bone ) proximal tibia ( upper shin bone ) measure infusion flow rate . We want see fast IV fluid infuse blood stream different infusion pressure . We also look route fluid travel IO needle arm leg heart . Another purpose study determine blood drawn bone use laboratory test blood drawn vein collect use finger stick .
DOC.criteria: Age 21 year old ; Have amputation upper low extremity ; Able lay flat table 2 hour ; Selfreported healthy ; Negative urine pregnancy test day inhouse study procedure ( female subject ) Have know active infection body ; Imprisoned ; Pregnant ; Cognitively impair ; Fracture humerus tibia , significant trauma site ; Excessive tissue and/or absence adequate anatomical landmark proximal humerus proximal tibia IO insertion site ; Infection target area ; Humeral/tibial IO insertion past 48 hour , prosthetic limb joint significant orthopedic procedure humerus tibia ; Current use anticoagulant ; Current cardiac condition require pacemaker antiarrhythmic drug ; Prior adverse reaction lidocaine ; History impair renal function ; Prior adverse reaction contrast medium ; Allergy iodine contain medication ; Allergy shellfish ; Have take analgesics/anesthetics day inhouse study procedure ; Volunteers follow characteristic may exclude study discretion PI ; Allergy food drug ; History impair hepatic function ; History cardiac disease ; History pheochromocytoma
